horizonms.samplers

horizonms.samplers.distributed

class horizonms.samplers.distributed.DistributedWeightedSampler(dataset: Dataset, weights: List[float] | str = 'square_root_inverse', replacement: bool = True, sampling_classes: int | None = None, *argv, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: DistributedSampler

Sampler that restricts data loading to a subset of the dataset. It samples elements such that the number of samples in different classes is determined by weights.

Parameters:

  • dataset (Dataset) – dataset to sample from.

  • weights (Union[List[float],str]) – It is ‘square_root’ (default), ‘equal’ or list of int, which defines the number of samples in each class.

  • sampling_classes (int) – number of classes in the dataset.

class horizonms.samplers.distributed.DistributedBalancedSampler(dataset: Dataset, samples_per_class: List[int] | str = 'square_root', sampling_classes: int | None = None, *argv, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: DistributedSampler

Sampler that restricts data loading to a subset of the dataset. It samples elements such that the number of samples in different classes is balanced based on a predefined sampling rule.

Parameters:

  • dataset (Dataset) – dataset to sample from.

  • samples_per_class (Union[List[int],str]) – sampling rule. It is ‘square_root’ (default), ‘equal’ or list of int, which defines the number of samples in each class.

  • sampling_classes (int) – number of classes in the dataset.

horizonms.samplers.patient_sampler

horizonms.samplers.patient_sampler.id_(x)[source]
horizonms.samplers.patient_sampler.map_(fn, iter)[source]
class horizonms.samplers.patient_sampler.PatientSampler(dataset: Dataset, grp_regex: str, shuffle: bool = False, quiet: bool = False)[source]

Bases: Sampler

Sampling all elements from a patient.

Parameters:

  • dataset (Dataset) – dataset to sample from.

  • grp_regex (str) – grep & regular expressions to search for text patterns to get samples from a patient.

  • shuffle (bool) – whether to shuffle the samples in the dataset.

  • quiet (bool) – whether to print the sampling information.

horizonms.samplers.sampler

class horizonms.samplers.sampler.BalancedSampler(dataset: Dataset, samples_per_class: List[int] | str = 'square_root', sampling_classes: int | None = None)[source]

Bases: Sampler[int]

Sampling elements such that the number of samples in different classes is balanced based on a predefined sampling rule.

Parameters:

  • dataset (Dataset) – dataset to sample from.

  • samples_per_class (Union[List[int],str]) – sampling rule. It is ‘square_root’ (default), ‘equal’ or list of int, which defines the number of samples in each class.

  • sampling_classes (int) – number of classes in the dataset.
